intro: Randia nigrescens, commonly known as black randia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, particularly Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. Its fruits are small, globose berries that turn from green to black as they mature. Randia nigrescens is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
